definition: to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture

sentences.english: Thereis a teacher's desk and many desks in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 有一个讲台和许多课桌在教室里。

sentences.english: After Henry had rung the bell, I approached the platform.
sentences.chinese: 亨利打了铃，我走向讲台。

sentences.english: He mounted the rostrum in vigorous strides.
This time he got up from his chair and strode to the lectern confidently.
sentences.chinese: 这次他从座位上站起来，迈着大步很自信地跨上讲台。

sentences.english: Jack emptied the bag to the floor sending the ping-pong balls rolling to the front of the room.
sentences.chinese: 杰克把乒乓球从纸袋里倒出来，把它们滚向了讲台。

sentences.english: The shoe landed on the stage about a metre from Mr Wen.
sentences.chinese: 该鞋在讲台上距温约一米处着陆。

sentences.english: He calmly stepped onto the platform.

sentences.chinese: 我们将在那里讲台语呢？

sentences.english: After the symphony orchestra finished its performance, the chairman stepped on platform.
sentences.chinese: 在交响乐团表演完后，主席走上讲台。

sentences.english: He hippety-hopped up the stage and interrupted the chairman.
sentences.chinese: 他一下子跳上了讲台，打断了主持人的讲话。

sentences.english: Three feet platform let teachers lead the way for others and sublimated oneself.
sentences.chinese: 三尺讲台使教师照亮了别人，也升华人自己。

sentences.english: So, on stage that day in Arusha, my English lost, I said something like, "I tried."
sentences.chinese: 所以那天站在阿鲁沙的讲台上时，我不会说英语了。

sentences.english: Choose several groups to read the words.
sentences.chinese: 由学生到讲台领读单词。

sentences.english: Between Tim green hair, goes podium finishes laughter.
sentences.chinese: 青丝之间添华发，三尺讲台荡笑声。

sentences.english: If you're going on the Hustings, let me add one element to the argument you might make.
sentences.chinese: 如果你站上竞选的讲台上你可能会赢。

sentences.english: Little more than 20 years of life on the rostrum to say what kind of boost.
sentences.chinese: 人生二十多年很少站在讲台上去多说什么的。

definition: teacher in charge of a class
to write on the blackboard/writing on the blackboard
to go to class/to attend class/to go to teach a class
to attend a class/to go to a lecture
